intro: Psychotria mariguidonensis, commonly known as the Mariguido psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
